divs: sighting detailsi had just finished fishing on a private lease 1\4 mile from city limits. it lies in the flight path for mid continent airport when winds are from the south. needless to say, i know what aircraft look like, and the lights on civilian and military aircraft. i had made a campfire, was listening to music and chilling out by myself. the owner of the fishing lease (sandpit) was having a get together across the lake and about 20 feet in elevation above me. i was facing due east. for some reason i felt compelled to turn around and face the west. when i did i noticed this round sphere of light moving from west to east appx 500-1000 feet in the air. it moved slowly, maybe 10-20 mph judging by the distance i observed it in the time allotted. it moved directly above my head. as it was getting nearer to me, i became a bit concerned and decided to grab my nikon d70 camera out of my trunk. i was a professional photographer in the past. i figured it was going to get me, at least i would leave evidence!! lol. anyway, it paused directly overhead of me and i managed to get one pic before it moved off. the object was pulsating red\white\red\white. it dissapeared above the tree line. i went out to the edge of the shore to locate the object but i was unable to see it any longer. what i found odd was the several people that were on the opposite shore and above my elevation, made no reaction to the object. i listened to hear if they spotted it, but, there was no indication that they say anything at all. weird, but, they might not have been looking my direction. i do have a photo that i want to submit for analysis, which is the very reason i have decided to report this incident anyway. the object made absolutely no noise, and was not traveling the direction that normal air traffic does common to the this area.
Summary: A pulsating red/white light slowly moving overhead
trends: There have been 39 other sightings in Wichita
There were no other sightings in Wichita on or around October 9th 2010
This sighting has never been favorited.
